medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute epigastric and right upper quadrant pain with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started acutely at midnight after eating scallops and shrimp, resulting in throbbing epigastric pain and nausea. The pain intensified after vomiting and is described as different from usual GERD symptoms. The patient vomited approximately 12 times with orange, non-bloody contents. Symptoms were reported as persistent.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV (CD4 1241), hiatal hernia, esophagitis, nephrolithiasis, hyperlipidemia, previous sinus surgery.
medical_history.social_history: Denies alcohol or recreational drug use.
